body:
In order to advertise on Facebook through AdRoll, you must link your Facebook business page with your AdRoll account. You’ll only need to complete this integration once, and it is relevant for both Click to website and Mobile app install* campaigns.

*If you want to run a mobile app install campaign, make sure you also complete "Requirements for Your Mobile App Install Campaign".

Jump to

  • How do I give AdRoll Advertiser access?
  • Why does AdRoll need "Advertiser" access?
  • Facebook integration troubleshooting

How do I give AdRoll “Advertiser” access?

Find “Integrations” within user settings. The user settings icon can be found in the top right corner of your AdRoll dashboard.

If you have not initiated this process, when you click on the link “Authorize AdRoll to access your Facebook Page”, you will see the below prompt:

3 steps to integrating Facebook

1. Click “Authorize AdRoll to access your Facebook page” (if integrating through the campaign creation tool, start at step 2) and enter your Facebook Page URL where prompted.

2. Next, log into Facebook to access your Facebook Notification Feed. You should see a request from AdRoll. Click to respond.

3. When prompted, select “Give AdRoll access to my Page”.

Why does AdRoll need Advertiser access?

We need access to your Facebook Page to to create your News Feed ads and pull the data we need to report on your campaign’s performance. For more information on managing page roles (and the differences in access levels), check out Facebook’s support article here.

Trouble adding your Facebook URL?

Make sure that the URL submitted links to your Facebook business page. Event or personal pages won't work.

If you have verified that the page you are trying to add is an eligible business page, but are still seeing an error, check for Country and Age restrictions on your Facebook business page.

Retargeting does not use demographic information. The discrepancy between your Facebook business page and retargeting campaign settings is what results in an error.

Removing restrictions
1. Log into your Facebook business page
2. Go to Settings
3. Click on the “General” tab
4. Make sure that Country and Age restrictions show “Page is visible to everyone”
Once complete, country and age restriction settings should look like this:

Didn’t see the notification?

You can also find the request by going to the “Page Roles” section of your Facebook Page settings. AdRoll’s request should appear as a Pending Agency Request.
